title: South Korean ex-defense minister attempts suicide: official
byline: Former South Korean Defence Minister Kim Yong-hyun, who is accused of playing a lead role in the failed imposition of martial law on Dec 3, has attempted suicide inside a detention centre, a justice ministry official told Parliament.

title: Adani Group opts out of US funding for Its Colombo Port project
byline: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led conglomerate on Tuesday said it will use its own resources to fund a Sri Lankan port project and not seek US funding.

title: New Chief Justice pledges to uphold judiciary’s integrity and independence
byline: Newly appointed Chief Justice Murdu Fernando, PC, yesterday pledged her unwavering commitment to upholding the integrity, independence, and dignity of the country’s judiciary as an independent and impartial arbiter of justice.

title: Cassilingam calls on diplomatic community to refrain from holding meetings with Speaker
byline: Geethanath Cassilingam, the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Jaffna District Organizer, has called on the diplomatic community to temporarily halt all engagements with the Speaker of Parliament, Ashoka Sapumal Ranwala, amid growing allegations surrounding the authenticity of his academic qualifications.

title: Liberal Youth Movement urges government inquiry into Speaker’s academic qualifications
byline: The Liberal Youth Movement has expressed deep concern over allegations questioning the authenticity of the academic qualifications presented by Speaker Ashoka Ranwala prior to the elections and during parliamentary proceedings.

title: PUCSL calls for public consultation on electricity tariff revision
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced the commencement of public consultations on the electricity tariff revision for the six-month period from January to June 2025, starting on December 17.

title: Niroshan Dickwella’s 3 year ban reduced to 3 months following appeal
byline: Sri Lankan cricketer Niroshan Dickwella’s three-year ban for an alleged anti-doping violation has been reduced to three months following an appeal.

title: S Korea police raid president’s office over martial law attempt
byline: Police in South Korea have raided the presidential office in Seoul, following President Yoon Suk Yeol’s abortive attempt to impose martial law last week.

title: Unidentified fever spreads in Jaffna, not confirmed as rat fever
byline: The sudden fever currently spreading in the Jaffna district has not yet been identified, nor has it been confirmed as rat fever (leptospirosis), Acting Consultant Community Physician of the Health Ministry’s Epidemiology Unit Dr. Kumudu Weerakoon said.

title: ITJP submits over 60 sanction requests against Sri Lankan officials
byline: The International Truth and Justice Project (ITJP) has submitted more than 60 sanctions and visa ban requests against Sri Lankan public and security officials to date for human rights and economic crimes in Sri Lanka and multiple universal jurisdiction cases.

title: Jerome not a Catholic Bishop, don’t get deceived: Catholic Church
byline: The Catholic Bishops Conference in Sri Lanka today clarified that Pastor Jerome Fernando was not a Bishop of the Catholic Church, and therefore the members of its church should not be deceived.

title: As Australia culls kangaroos to protect their land, we can export monkeys to other countries
byline: If the Australian government has recently culled millions of kangaroos to protect their land, Sri Lanka could consider measures to export harmful animal populations causing significant damage to crops, former Minister Mahinda Amaraweera suggested.

title: SJB considering bringing in no-confidence motion against Speaker
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) is considering bringing in a no-confidence motion against Speaker Ashoka Ranwala as an option, SJB MP Ajith P. Perera said today.

title: Faizar Musthafa’s name gazetted as NDF National List MP
byline: The Election Commission has gazetted the name of Mohomed Faizar Musthafa as a National List MP of the New Democratic Front (NDF).

title: Govt ready to resume discussion on exporting Toque monkeys: Minister
byline: The government is ready to take up the discussion again on exporting Toque Macaque monkeys to China as one solution to the monkey menace, Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation Lal Kantha said today.

title: Will hand over MP Archuna to Police if he disrupts hospital operations: Jaffna Hospital Director
byline: Director of the Jaffna Teaching Hospital, Dr. T. Sathyamoorthy, said that if MP Ramanathan Archchuna visits the hospital again and disrupts its operations, he will be captured and handed over to the Jaffna Police.

title: Death toll in Jaffna fever outbreak climbs to five
byline: The death toll from an unidentified fever spreading in Jaffna has risen to five, confirmed Jaffna Hospital Director Dr. T. Sathyamoorthy during a media briefing.
